titleStmt.title: G. W. Sweeny et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG13828

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.idno: QMG Box 10; Folder Some 1862, 1863, Misc. Correspondence, Recommendation for Jobs, Claims for Pay, Vouchers for Expenses...Few on Ordinance

body.p:
Head Quarters 13th Ky Cavlry
Septemer 28th 1863
To ^his^ Excencly the Governor of Ky --

your petitioners would State that they are officers of the said 13th Ky Cav.. Regiment and that they are personally acquainted with Daniel S Parker -- and Know that he has done much good in the gitting up of this Regiment -- having devoted his whole time and attention and Spirit Considerable money to obtain recruits for its Benefit -- Beleaving that he was to hold the office of Agutant -- in which capacity he has been acting for the past 2 months, Now we the undersigned officers do petition your Exencly to Commission D. S. Parker to the office of Agutant of this 13th Ky cav -- vols

Maj -- G W Sweeny
maj J A Morrison
2nd Lt Gabbert
Maj Rigney
F K W. Chapman Lt
H H Hurt capt
J R Howard Capt
Wm M Northridge Capt
Wm D Lowe 1 Lieut
James M Giboney Capt
Thoms Watson Capt
Capt Thomas Woods
Lt Moses Hudleston
Lt Ben F Bransam
Lt. Joseph Cartwright
George T Rigney
Jesse C
Lt S Bowman

13 Cavy
Petition recommending D. S. Parker for position of Adjutant
Duplicaton Com. forwd Sept 30. 1863
